Key Match Events: Minnesota Twins lost to the Baltimore Orioles 6-2 on September 29, 2024.
The Twins lost 27 of their last 39 games, ending their playoff contention.
Pre-Game Insights: Joe Pohlad, the Executive Chair of the Twins, met with reporters before the game and discussed the team's financial decisions.
Post-Match Reflections: Joe Pohlad explained the decision to cut payroll as a tough business decision.
Pohlad expressed that he felt like he was watching a trainwreck during the last month and a half of the season.
Pohlad confirmed that Derek Falvey and Rocco Baldelli would return next season despite the team's poor performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins were one of nine teams to draw fewer than 2 million fans in 81 home games this season.
The Twins' collapse included losses in seven of their last eight games, being outscored 41-16.
